title: For Sale:  BCM Hammer forged 11.5" barreled receiver
location: St. Louis county, St. Louis, Missouri
postcontent:
I am the original owner of a factory-built BFH 11.5" BCM upper receiver.  I had the front sight base shaved down to retain the secure attachment of taper pins and allow me to install a FF hand guard over it.  I also had the delta ring and springs removed.  I ran this upper with a Centurion arms C4 rail since it fits on the standard barrel nut.

The upper has run flawlessly for 600 rounds, some being suppressed.  I recently assembled a new upper and I just don't need this one anymore.  What you see is what you get.  No bolt carrier group, no charging handle, no rail.  Just slap on any free float rail that attaches to a standard barrel nut and you are good to go.

At the price of $375, shipping will be included to the lower 48 states (so be sure this is legal where you are).

It is the responsibility of the buyer to now, and abide by, all NFA, federal and local laws before purchasing.  This will make a great upper for your AR pistol (with no stock) or for your registered SBR lower.

The 43 has 63 flawless rounds fired 50 fmj and 13 jhp, there are a couple marks on top of the chamber from the slide, other than that it's like new. I picked up a Gen 4 26 last week and I prefer it to the 43,  there is nothing wrong with the 43, the 26 just fits my hand better. The 43 also fits well I my Don Hume IWB Holster. I have owned or handled pf9, CM 9, pm 9, xds 9,  shield  and a few other comparable single stack 9mm and the 43 fits my hands best. Just my opinion. 

Cash price $550 or best reasonable offer. 

Straight trade for Gen 4 26, 19, 23 with all that they come with from the factory,  I'll add cash or something else if it comes with caliber conversion barrels. Gen 4 32 if it comes with either a 9mm or 40s&w conversion barrel, if it comes with both I'll add some cash or something else.

Other Gen 4 Glocks plus cash or accessories.

postcontent:
Beretta Silver Pigeon III 20ga 28" O/U UNFIRED in original case with paperwork and chokes.  Gun is in perfect condition.  Regular MSRP $3425

Bradford Ballistics

408 S Hwy 377 Pilot Point TX 76258

REDACTED Open M-F 10-7, Sat 10-4



The Silver Pigeon III over-under hunting shotgun is the mid-level offering of the Beretta Silver Pigeon line. It has all the benefits of the Silver Pigeon I plus more extensive game engraving and a stock oval for the ownerâ€™s initials, while not featuring the gold inlays of the Silver Pigeon V. Weighing only about 7 lbs, it handles wonderfully as a game gun while not being too light for a long session at the clay range. It is available in 12 and 20 gauge, or in 28 gauge with a petite scaled frame.



Natural Pointability, Swing

The Silver Pigeon is built on the legendary 687 action, a long-standing favorite among hunters and competitive shooters. It features two conical locking lugs at mid-action, right between the barrels, giving it great locking strength and durability while keeping the actionâ€™s profile considerably lower. The advantage is that the eye of the shooter is a lot closer to the plane of his supporting hand, resulting in a considerably better swing and hand-eye coordination.



Tough, Accurate Barrels

Available with 26â€ or 28â€ barrels, the Silver Pigeon III is a shotgun designed to last several lifetimes in spite of its lightness and fast handling. The chrome-moly cold-hammer forged barrels of the Silver Pigeon III are designed to take the punishment of heavy hunting loads without compromising in shot pattern and durability. Also, the forcing cone is elongated to provide less shot deformation and recoil, while the MobilChoke system is further designed to resist stress and ensure durability.


 Great Looks, Finish

Something that never fails to impress about the Silver Pigeon III are its premium looks. The game scene on the receiver is rich and full of artistic details, while the trigger guard and top lever are embellished with a tasteful scroll. The select walnut stock features a super-crisp checkering pattern that affords a positive grip while further enhancing the elegance of this shotgun. And the perfect proportions and unmistakable Beretta lines wonâ€™t fail to turn heads at the range, even from a distance.
